text.0: sing forth o kaṇvas to your band of maruts unassailable.
text.2: they who selfluminous were born together with the spotted deer.
text.4: one hears as though twere close at hand the cracking of the whips they hold.
text.5: they gather glory on their way.
text.6: now sing ye forth the godgiven hymn to your exultant marut host.
text.8: praise ye the bull among the cows for tis the maruts sportive band.
text.9: it strengthened as it drank the rain.
text.10: who is your mightiest heroes when o shakers of the earth and heaven.
text.11: ye shake them like a garments hem.
text.12: at your approach man holds him down before the fury of your wrath.
text.14: they at whose racings forth the earth like an ageweakened lord of men.
text.15: trembles in terror on their ways.
text.16: strong is their birth vigour have they to issue from their mother strength.
text.17: yea even twice enough is theirs.
text.18: and these the sons the singers in their racings have enlarged the bounds.
text.19: so that the kine must walk kneedeep.
text.20: before them on the ways they go they drop this offspring of the cloud.
text.22: o maruts as your strength is great so have ye cast men down on earth.
text.23: so have ye made the mountains fall.
text.24: the while the maruts pass along they talk together on the way.
text.25: doth any hear them as they speak.
text.26: come quick with swift steeds for ye have worshippers among kaṇvas sons.
text.27: may you rejoice among them well.
text.28: all is prepared for your delight we are their servants evermore.
text.29: to live as long as life may last.
